description: A look back at the tools and apps I've used in the past

body.name: Arc Browser
body.description: An innovative browser that re-imagined web navigation with command bar, split tabs but the shift in its development focus and regional website inaccessibility prompted me to explore alternatives.

body.name: iTerm2
body.description: My long-time favorite terminal emulator for macOS. It's powerful and customizable, but I'm currently trying out Ghostty as a potential replacement.

body.name: Firefox
body.description: My go-to browser for years, valued for its commitment to privacy and its open-source nature.

body.name: Dracula Theme
body.description: My previous dark theme of choice. It offered great consistency across many applications, but I've since switched to Catppuccin.

body.name: TablePlus
body.description: An excellent database management tool that was essential for my work. I've moved it here as my current projects no longer require direct database access.

body.name: Authy
body.description: My previous two-factor authentication app. I switched to 2FAS for a more open and straightforward experience, especially after the discontinuation of the Authy desktop app.
